definitions.definition: A concave vessel for drinking from, usually made of opaque material (as opposed to a glass) and with a handle.
definitions.example: Pour the tea into the cup.

definitions.definition: The contents of said vessel; a cupful.
definitions.example: I drank two cups of water but still felt thirsty.

definitions.definition: A customary unit of measure
A trophy in the shape of an oversized cup.
definitions.example: The World Cup is awarded to the winner of a quadrennial football tournament.

definitions.definition: A contest for which a cup is awarded.
definitions.example: The World Cup is the world's most widely watched sporting event.

definitions.definition: The main knockout tournament in a country, organised alongside the league.
A cup-shaped object placed in the target hole.
definitions.example: The ball just misses the cup.

definitions.definition: (in combination) Any of various sweetened alcoholic drinks.
definitions.example: cider cup; gin cup; claret cup

definitions.definition: A rigid concave protective covering for the male genitalia. (for UK usage see box)
definitions.example: Players of contact sports are advised to wear a cup.

definitions.definition: One of the two parts of a brassiere which each cover a breast.
definitions.example: The cups are made of a particularly uncomfortable material.

definitions.definition: The symbol \cup denoting union and similar operations (confer cap).
A suit of the minor arcana in tarot, or one of the cards from the suit.
(ultimate frisbee) A defensive style characterized by a three player near defense cupping the thrower; or those three players.
A flexible concave membrane used to temporarily attach a handle or hook to a flat surface by means of suction (suction cup).
Anything shaped like a cup.
A cupping glass or other vessel or instrument used to produce the vacuum in cupping.
That which is to be received or indured; that which is allotted to one; a portion of blessings and afflictions.
To form into the shape of a cup, particularly of the hands.
definitions.example: Cup your hands and I'll pour some rice into them.

definitions.definition: To hold something in cupped hands.
definitions.example: He cupped the ball carefully in his hands.

definitions.definition: To pour (a liquid, drink, etc.) into a cup.
definitions.example: We are cupping some new brands of coffee today.

definitions.definition: To supply with cups of wine.
To apply a cupping apparatus to; to subject to the operation of cupping.
To make concave or in the form of a cup.
definitions.example: to cup the end of a screw
